intro: Stipa mongholica f. alpina, commonly known as the alpine feathergrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is a perennial species characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit and delicate, silver-green foliage. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny, pale green to brownish florets. It thrives in high-altitude environments, such as mountain meadows and rocky slopes, where it is adapted to cold and arid conditions. Its botanical features make it an important component of alpine ecosystems, contributing to soil stabilization and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
